required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of [¹⁴C]-LY3484356 in Healthy Female Participants
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Two-part Study of the Disposition and Absolute Bioavailability of [¹⁴C]-LY3484356 in Healthy Females of Non-Childbearing Potential

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to measure how much of the study drug gets into the bloodstream and how long it takes the body to get rid of it. This study has two parts. It will involve a single dose of 14C radiolabeled LY3484356. This means that a radioactive substance C14 will be incorporated into the study drug, to investigate the study drug and its breakdown products, to find out how much of these pass from blood into urine, feces and expired air. The study will last about 4 weeks. Screening is required within 28 days prior to the start of the study and follow up is required approximately 7 days after discharge.

primary_outcome.measure: Fecal Excretion of LY3484356 Radioactivity Over Time Expressed as a Percentage of the Total Radioactive Dose Administered
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
primary_outcome.description: Fecal Excretion of LY3484356 Radioactivity Over Time Expressed as a Percentage of the Total Radioactive Dose Administered

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary Excretion of LY3484356 Radioactivity Over Time Expressed as a Percentage of the Total Radioactive Dose Administered
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
primary_outcome.description: Urinary Excretion of LY3484356 Radioactivity Over Time Expressed as a Percentage of the Total Radioactive Dose Administered

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 9 post dose

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC (0-∞)) of Total Radioactivity, LY3484356 and [¹⁴C]-LY3484356
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: PK: (AUC (0-∞)) of Total Radioactivity, LY3484356 and [¹⁴C]-LY3484356

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Total Radioactivity, LY3484356 and [¹⁴C]-LY3484356
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: PK: Cmax of Total Radioactivity, LY3484356 and [¹⁴C]-LY3484356

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Radioactivity Recovered in Urine, Feces, and Expired Air (if applicable).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Total Radioactivity Recovered in Urine, Feces, and Expired Air (if applicable).

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Metabolites of LY3484356
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to Day 12 post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Total Number of Metabolites of LY3484356

arm_group.description: Single dose of LY3484356 administered orally followed by Single dose of [¹⁴C]-LY3484356 administered intravenously (IV).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female participants of nonchildbearing potential. This includes females who are not pregnant, non-lactating and either: Infertile due to surgical sterilization or alternate medical cause/congenital or postmenopausal.
- Body mass index (BMI) within the range of 18.0 to 35.0 kilograms per meter squared (kg/m²)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant history or clinical manifestation of any metabolic, allergic, dermatological, hepatic, renal, hematological, pulmonary, cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, neurological, respiratory, endocrine, or psychiatric disorders
- Have evidence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and/or positive human HIV antibodies
- Have known allergies to LY3484356, related compounds or any components of the formulation as appropriate, or history of significant atopy
